basics.name: Markus Ernst Mikschi
basics.label: PhD student
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: TU Wien - Research Group Higher Geodesy
highlights: Data analysis and arameter estimation for global VLBI networks in weighted least squares adjustments
Contributing to the development of the analysis software VieVs (https://vievswiki.geo.tuwien.ac.at)
Prediction of Earth orientation parameters using Machine Lerning
Scientific poster presentation at EVGA 2019 conference

publications.name: Unconstrained Estimation of VLBI Global Observing System Station Coordinates
publications.summary: The coordinates of radio telescopes, which are part of the emerging VLBI Global Observing System, were estimated in a least squares unconstrained adjustment. The higher number of observations per time with better sky coverage, which these telescopes can produce, was optimally utilized by testing different intervals for the tropospheric delay estimation.
